intro: Satureja montana var. prostrata, commonly known as匍匐鼠尾草 or prostrate sage, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, aromatic leaves that are typically gray-green in color and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tiny, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in spikes along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Its medicinal properties include antimicrobial and antioxidant effects, making it valuable in traditional herbal medicine.
